p: The cluster composition plays an important role in the overall energy distribution. Since the Sc–N–Sc angle is close to 2π/3, stable COS-0 conformers can also be obtained for Θ = 2π/3 (in this case another Sc atom has a vertical orientation). Indeed, clustering of low-energy conformers can be seen near Θ = 2π/3. In total, the energy distribution of the COS-0 conformers is very dense, giving only a moderate ordering effect for the energy cut-off of 1 k B T at room temperature. For the YSc 2N cluster in the COS-1 system, the situation is different. The conformer with Θ = 0 corresponds to the well-defined global minimum. If the positions of Y and one Sc atom are flipped (giving Θ = 2π/3), the energies increase by ca. 5 kJ mol −1. Thus, the ordering effect for YSc 2N@C 80·Ni(OEP) is more pronounced and gives essentially one structure for the energy cut-off of Δ E = 2.5 kJ mol −1.
